image.altText: a man stands holding up a t-shirt which reads 'don't let the bastards wear you down'

props.synopsis: Indigenous Townsville man Terry Irving spent four-and-a-half years behind bars after he was found guilty of robbing Cairns bank in 1993, but a court has ruled he was prosecuted maliciously.

title.children: Queensland man jailed for a crime he didn't commit says a state apology would mean more than money

image.altText: Patric Brady

props.synopsis: Oxenford State School principal Patric Brady has been charged with more child sex offences, relating to the grooming of children in the Philippines.

title.children: Gold Coast school principal faces fresh child grooming charges

image.altText: wall to wall use

props.synopsis: A 58-year-old Gold Coast police officer has died during an annual police remembrance ride from Brisbane to Canberra.

title.children: Gold Coast officer dies in motorcycle crash during remembrance ride for police killed in line of duty

image.altText: Aerial view of Big Red Bash festival site

props.synopsis: The Big Red Bash, which injects millions of dollars into the western Queensland economy, has been cancelled for 2025 with organisers saying they are "taking a breather".

title.children: Australia's most remote music festival cancelled next year with organisers 'overdue a break'

image.altText: A folder with some documents next to an ABC Radio Brisbane logo

props.synopsis: One of Queensland's largest councils has told the ABC to destroy a leaked spreadsheet and legal letters showing 281 cases of illegal dog regulation.

title.children: Council tries to gag ABC over leaked documents showing unlawful dog regulation

image.altText: A 3D animation shows new luggage scanners inside the airport.

props.synopsis: Brisbane's international airport is getting a facelift as part of a $5 billion plan to upgrade the space over the next decade.

title.children: Brisbane Airport to improve check-ins as part of international terminal upgrade

image.altText: A pile of tablets with embossed numbers and letters sits on a dark surface

props.synopsis: Australians are using almost half the amount of oxycodone they were before 2019, a new study detecting opioid levels in wastewater finds.

title.children: Oxycodone consumption halves after prescription rule change

image.altText: The former Queensland Government Printing Office in George Street, Brisbane

props.synopsis: The luxury shopping precinct at Brisbane's Queen's Wharf is in limbo because the project developer is locked in a court battle over the condition of the heritage retail space.

title.children: Brisbane's proposed luxury shopping precinct in doubt, while a court dispute is underway

image.altText: A young woman comforts an older man holding a stress ball

props.synopsis: Major changes in aged care are coming, after months of back-room negotiations over sensitive reforms including requiring many new aged care entrants to pay more for their own care.

title.children: Elderly Australians to pay more under aged care deal struck by government

image.altText: 2008 Afghanistan War

props.synopsis: As many as nine current and former personnel have had their honours taken away by the Defence minister, over alleged war crimes that happened under their command in Afghanistan, while others still face the prospect of prosecution.

title.children: Defence commanders stripped of medals after Afghanistan war crimes investigation ends

props.synopsis: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese has announced a deal on major changes to the aged care sector. Follow live.

title.children: PM scores political win after months-long stand off

image.altText: Two boys hold fishing rods and smile at the camera next to a lake.

props.synopsis: In a statement released through NSW Police, Nick Smith says the deaths of his sons, Russell and Ben, aged nine and 11, have caused "unimaginable pain and distress".

title.children: Boys found dead in Blue Mountains home 'loved sports, fishing and Max their pup', father says

image.altText: Silhouette of man in front of green screen displaying a Linux command window.

props.synopsis: The ABC is told the cyber breach was "extensive" and that the group behind the hack was intent on gathering information about the Pacific Islands Forum Secretariat and its operations.

title.children: Australia sends expert teams to Fiji as Chinese state-backed hackers attack Pacific Islands Forum

image.altText: A protest in Melbourne's CBD

props.synopsis: The second day of demonstration comes following fiery clashes on Wednesday that saw 42 protesters arrested and dozens of police officers injured.

title.children: Anti-war protests continue near defence industry expo in Melbourne's CBD

image.altText: Passengers stand on a train platform in Jakarta

props.synopsis: Indonesia's public rail operator will blacklist perpetrators of sexual violence after a spate of reported attacks on trains.

title.children: Harassment is a problem on Jakarta's public transport. Now perpetrators will be banned from trains for life

image.altText: Adam Bray, right, and Zach Bray who died in the hunter bus crash of June 11, 2023

props.synopsis: Adam Bray, who lost his son Zach in the crash, says the class action will target Transport for NSW for providing "very poor infrastructure". It comes after the bus driver was sentenced to 32 years' jail.

title.children: Father of Hunter Valley bus crash victim to launch class action against Transport for NSW

image.altText: Qantas CEO Alan Joyce seated and smiling for a TV interview.

props.synopsis: Qantas has revealed it paid former CEO Alan Joyce an extra $3.4 million for his last two months in the role.

title.children: Qantas has revealed it paid former CEO Alan Joyce an extra $3.4 million for his last two months in the role

image.altText: An architectural render of a five storey apartment buidling

props.synopsis: A developer is working to speed up the approval of a 75-unit apartment complex in the heart of Toowoomba under a new state planning initiative, in a bid to get more social and affordable housing onto the market.

title.children: From a carpark to 'beautiful' homes, not-for-profit developer seeks to fast-track affordable apartments

image.altText: A bald man wearing a white shirt and jeans sits on a bench next to a large green plant.

props.synopsis: For four years, Gary Jubelin was the lead investigator of William Tyrrell's disappearance. A decade since the three-year-old went missing, the former detective has called for better transparency and accountability into the case.

title.children: Former William Tyrrell detective says he has 'concerns' over police tunnel vision

image.altText: A tiny lizard sits in a man's hand.

props.synopsis: A new study reveals the scale of Australia wildlife being smuggled overseas, with dozens of species recorded for the first time. But government authorities insist its crackdown is working.

title.children: A growing number of rare Australian animals sold across the globe as new study lays bare 'wild harvest'

image.altText: A screenshot of a Facebook page titled "Election News".

props.synopsis: Conservative lobby group Advance Australia is dressing old news articles up as new developments and paying Facebook's parent company Meta for the articles to appear in the news feeds of Australians.

title.children: A Facebook page is running a 'malicious malinformation campaign'. Meta says it doesn't break the rules

image.altText: An aerial view showing black cattle grazing in a bare paddock near a fallen tree

props.synopsis: Environmental powerhouse, or toothless tiger? Michael Slezak looks at the impact of a proposed federal regulator, in light of how land clearing is managed in Australia.

title.children: Successive Australian governments have done little to stop illegal land clearing. Will a new environmental regulator do the trick?

image.altText: A crowd of people walking around a damaged school.

props.synopsis: The UN Palestinian refugee agency UNRWA has labelled the deaths of six staffers killed in air strikes which hit a school in central Gaza as "just tragic," claiming on X that "no one is safe".

title.children: Six UN refugee agency workers reportedly killed in air strike Israel claims was targeting Hamas militants — as it happened

image.altText: Lachie Whitfield sitting on the ground and Josh Kelly bent over, reacting to an AFL finals loss

props.synopsis: Port Adelaide and GWS need to quickly bounce back from disappointing losses, or their seasons could end prematurely despite being top-four sides.

title.children: GWS and Port have a second chance at the AFL finals but need to make improvements

image.altText: An aerial view of a town

props.synopsis: Leaders in Kintore are calling for additional support for their remote Indigenous community amid a spike in young people petrol sniffing and the temporary closure of its only school.

title.children: Teachers evacuated, school closed after 'criminal damage' in remote NT community

image.altText: The street outside the Castlemaine Town Hall covered in a blanket of hail.

props.synopsis: A thick blanket of hail transformed the central Victorian town of Castlemaine into a winter wonderland last night, but it's become a nightmare for council and for families with damaged homes.

title.children: Castlemaine buildings shut, ceilings collapse under weight of hail as storm sends 'water and chaos everywhere'

image.altText: Tanya Plibersek in a white jacket.

props.synopsis: The federal government's signature nature protection reforms are on the cusp of collapsing, with Labor increasingly ready to walk away if it cannot do a deal with the Coalition.

title.children: Nature protection reforms at edge of collapse, as government readies to walk away without a deal

image.altText: Nine CEO Mike Sneesby sitting in the studio

props.synopsis: Nine Entertainment has announced that Mike Sneesby will step down as chief executive, revealing he would leave at the end of the month after a "challenging" year at the network.

title.children: Nine chief executive Mike Sneesby steps down after 'challenging' year for the network

image.altText: An aerial view of a beach set at the foot of grassy cliffs

props.synopsis: A new wave of construction is sweeping Bali, carving up rice fields and prime beachfront land for "Instagrammable" villas, resorts and massive tourism projects.

title.children: The towering 'eyesore' Bali is building on the 'world's most beautiful beach'

image.altText: Alberto Fujimori sits next to a microphone.

props.synopsis: Alberto Fujimori was the country's president from 1990 until 2000, when he was convicted of human rights abuses.

title.children: Alberto Fujimori, ex-president of Peru known for economic reforms and authoritarianism, dies at 86

image.altText: Olivia Gadecki smiles up at the stands

props.synopsis: Olivia Gadecki has scored the biggest win of her career with a straight-sets dismissal of world number 11 Danielle Collins in Guadalajara.

title.children: Aussie qualifier claims biggest career win at Guadalajara Open

image.altText: Michelle Rowland stands at the despatch box to answer a question during Question Time in federal parliament.

props.synopsis: While the Coalition is all in favour of banning kids from social media, it's less clear how it will respond to the crackdown on mis and disinformation.

title.children: Government declares war on big tech, but can it actually win?

image.altText: ASX in Sydney

props.synopsis: The Australian share market is higher today ahead of a widely anticipated interest rate decision from the European Central Bank. Follow the day's events and insights on the live markets blog.

title.children: ASX rises ahead of European Central Bank's interest rate decision

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Woodside Energy shuts US oil field after Hurricane Francine's arrival
European Central Bank to hand down interest rate decision later

image.altText: Notre Dame stained glass window showing a napping man.

props.synopsis: Humans didn't always sleep straight through the night, and we didn't always have to deal with a regulated work or school day. Modern culture is responsible for some of the most enduring misconceptions about sleep. Here are seven common myths.

title.children: The key to a good night's sleep? Knowing your body and ignoring these myths
